net.semanticmetadata.lire.imageanalysis

Interface LireFeature

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Histogram
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AutoColorCorrelogram, BasicFeatures, BinaryPatternsPyramid, CEDD, ColorLayout, CvSiftFeature, CvSurfFeature, EdgeHistogram, FCTH, Feature, FuzzyColorHistogram, FuzzyOpponentHistogram, Gabor, GenericByteLireFeature, GenericDoubleLireFeature, JCD, JointHistogram, JpegCoefficientHistogram, LocalBinaryPatterns, LocalBinaryPatternsAndOpponent, LuminanceLayout, MSERFeature, OpponentHistogram, PHOG, RankAndOpponent, RotationInvariantLocalBinaryPatterns, ScalableColor, SimpleColorHistogram, SPACC, SPCEDD, SPFCTH, SPJCD, SPLBP, SurfFeature, Tamura

    public interface LireFeature
extends Histogram
    This is the basic interface for all content based features. It is needed for GenericDocumentBuilder etc. Date: 28.05.2008 Time: 14:44:16
    Author:
    Mathias Lux, mathias@juggle.at

    • Method Detail

      • getFeatureName

        java.lang.String getFeatureName()
        Gives a descriptive name of the feature, i.e. a name to show up in benchmarks, menus, UIs, etc.
        Returns:
        the name of the feature.

      • getFieldName

        java.lang.String getFieldName()
        Returns the preferred field name for indexing.
        Returns:
        the field name preferred for indexing in a Lucene index.

      • extract

        void extract(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Extracts the feature vector from a BufferedImage.
        Parameters:
        image - the source image

      • getByteArrayRepresentation

        byte[] getByteArrayRepresentation()
        Returns a compact byte[] based representation of the feature vector.
        Returns:
        a compact byte[] array containing the feature vector.
        See Also:
        setByteArrayRepresentation(byte[])

      • setByteArrayRepresentation

        void setByteArrayRepresentation(byte[] featureData)
        Sets the feature vector values based on the byte[] data. Use getByteArrayRepresentation() to generate a compatible byte[] array.
        Parameters:
        featureData - the byte[] data.
        See Also:
        getByteArrayRepresentation()

      • setByteArrayRepresentation

        void setByteArrayRepresentation(byte[] featureData,
                              int offset,
                              int length)
        Sets the feature vector values based on the byte[] data. Use getByteArrayRepresentation() to generate a compatible byte[] array.
        Parameters:
        featureData - the byte[] array containing the data.
        offset - the offset, i.e. where the feature vector starts.
        length - the length of the data representing the feature vector.
        See Also:
        getByteArrayRepresentation()

      • getDoubleHistogram

        double[] getDoubleHistogram()
        Convenience method to get the feature vector as double[] array. This method is used by classifiers, etc.
        Specified by:
        getDoubleHistogram in interface Histogram
        Returns:
        the feature vector as a double[] array.

      • getDistance

        float getDistance(LireFeature feature)
        The distance function for this type of feature
        Parameters:
        feature - the feature vector to compare the current instance to.
        Returns:
        the distance (or dissimilarity) between the instance and the parameter.

      • getStringRepresentation

        java.lang.String getStringRepresentation()
        Legacy method from a time, when feature vectors were stored as Strings in Lucene. This is not recommended, as Strings are immutable and therefore a lot of unnecessary object instances are created.
        Returns:
        the feature vector as String.

      • setStringRepresentation

        void setStringRepresentation(java.lang.String featureVector)
        Legacy method from a time, when feature vectors were stored as Strings in Lucene. This is not recommended, as Strings are immutable and therefore a lot of unnecessary object instances are created.
        Parameters:
        featureVector -
        See Also:
        getStringRepresentation()
